page.title: 17LANDSCAPE
page.content: We walked out of the village towards the agricultural area.The first noticeable object was a water pump, erected by the governors of the Charter House in 1832.The pump is rusty and it squeaks when trying to pump water. Some of the flowers to be seen are Persian Speedwell,White Dead Nettle, Wild rose,Dandelion and Blackthorn. Further on is the Essex Water Authority which supplies Water to the village. At the end of the Marsh Road,in the distance were some tall chimneys, probably in Kent. On the return journey,swans were seen swimming in a pond,some of their feathers were lying around.
